job_titles: Patient Phone Support - freelance position The Netherlands
job_description:
We are currently recruiting for a freelancer, home-based in The Netherlands.
In this role you will provide telephone support to patients in our Rare Disease Patient Support Program. The workload may vary from week to week (on demand).
Job Description:
Supporting patients in 5 EU countries - France, Spain, Italy, Germany and the UK
Answering patient calls and providing telephone consultation/support to patients
Provide specific training to patients
Participation in 2 - 3 days of training
Documentation and reporting
Requirements:
Registered Nurse, scientific or paramedical background
Fluent in at least 3 of the following languages: Spanish, French, Italian, German and English
Communicative personality
Ability to work autonomously
Available to take calls from 9:00 to 17:00 h and from Monday to Friday or call back within reasonable time
Good computer skills
IQVIA is a leading global provider of advanced analytics, technology solutions and clinical research services to the life sciences industry. We believe in pushing the boundaries of human science and data science to make the biggest impact possible – to help our customers create a healthier world. Learn more at https://jobs.iqvia.com

People Operations Manager, International HR
Location : Netherlands, Germany, Switzerland
Requisition Number: 440
How will your role help us transform hope into reality ?
Our company has attracted some of the most brilliant and accomplished talents in the industry and is now looking for an entrepreneurial, strategic, and well-rounded People Operations Manager, International HR who excels when opportunity knocks.
This exciting opportunity for an experienced HR professional provides an opening to help build the international infrastructure which drives value creation and paves the way for continuous personal development. This individual will bring their unique perspective coupled with intelligence, an appreciation for the business, and a natural passion for rapid, yet informed change to maximize our collective success.
The successful candidate will partner day-to-day with our employees, candidates, external service providers, the US/ HR /Finance team, and internal stakeholders. This role is a central and critical role within the HR Organization as we embark on the next chapter of the Blueprint Medicines’ story.
The incumbent will start ASAP. Reporting into Head of Total Rewards & People Operations International, the successful candidate should have strong analytical, organizational, and problem-solving skills and be able to drive financial processes effectively across the International Region. In this role he/ she will work with our entities and partners abroad to establish effective and efficient work processes and solutions for our international employees, in order to deliver a positive and engaging employee experience.
What will you do ?
HR & Benefits Management and Administration
Manage and optimize the operations related to employee life cycle (employment contracts, onboarding, registration/de-registration of employees with tax authorities and insurance companies, work permits, absences, etc). Elaborate all employment documentation such as contracts of employment, alterations, and reference letters
Drive and own the entire administrative HR life within the full employee life cycle (from hiring to separation) with payroll agencies/benefits vendors/employers of record for our employees based internationally
Coordinate and execute the benefits enrollment/ vendors communication ensuring a unique employee experience
Support for implementing new benefits programs/ new HR and Total Reward projects
Elaborate, optimize, and implement HR procedures, policies and processes and ensures compliance across the region and countries
Stay up to date on employment laws & regulations
Ensure adequate service level for HR Operations customers across region
Payroll & Reporting
Coordinate the International payroll in close partnership with Head of Total Rewards & People Operations International: prepare the payroll input, monitor processing and check the payroll output.
Coordinate and support the year end payroll activities, in house and external reports, payment compliance
Drive HR controlling and organizational metrics, including headcount reporting, dashboards, absence reports etc.
HRIS / HR Digital
Support optimization and automatization in HR Operations processes
Ensure the proper functionality, data quality and compliance of HR systems within International
HRIS reports
Be an active member of Business Unit or Function meetings, participating in meetings, and working collaboratively to drive business performance.
Comply with Company guidelines and country/industry standards on ethics and compliance.
Act as a role model
Ensure that all activities are undertaken in accordance with all SOPs, policies, directives and relevant national guidelines
What minimum qualifications do we require ?
Multiple years’ experience in an International HR Admin/Operations role or experience in HR Operations /Shared Services or sizeable HR Administrative function within a global organization and matrix Organization
What additional qualifications will make you a stronger candidate ?
Business-fluent in English
HR Generalist with solid knowledge of theory and best practice of HR policies, processes and practices
Good knowledge of Employee Service Management technology
Highly structured, systematic and organized, focused and details oriented
Out of the Box thinker in every aspect / Can-Do attitude
Driven and entrepreneurial mindset with the ability to work independently and proactively
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills
Customer-focused mindset and capabilities in providing internal stakeholders the best possible service
Well-organized, hands on, flexible and ability to handle different priorities at a time – result driven and strategic thinker
Business-fluent French and/ or German a plus
Commitment to our Core Values: Patients First, Thoughtfulness, Urgency, Trust, Optimism
Blueprint Medicines is a global precision therapy company that invents life-changing therapies for people with cancer and blood disorders. Applying an approach that is both precise and agile, we create medicines that selectively target genetic drivers, with the goal of staying one step ahead across stages of disease. Since 2011, we have leveraged our research platform, including expertise in molecular targeting and world-class drug design capabilities, to rapidly and reproducibly translate science into a broad pipeline of precision therapies. Today, we are delivering approved medicines directly to patients in the United States and Europe , and we are globally advancing multiple programs for systemic mastocytosis , lung cancer and other genomically defined cancers, and cancer immunotherapy. For more information, visit www.BlueprintMedicines.com and follow us on Twitter (@BlueprintMeds) and LinkedIn .

Überblick:

Bruker is enabling scientists to make breakthrough discoveries and develop new applications that improve the quality of human life. As one of the world’s leading analytical instrumentation companies, Bruker develops high-performance scientific instruments and high-value analytical and diagnostic solutions that enable scientists to explore life and materials at molecular, cellular, and microscopic levels. We have been driving innovation in analytical instrumentation for 60 years and today, Bruker continues to build upon its extensive range of products and solutions, its broad base of installed systems, and a strong reputation among its customers. Worldwide, more than 7,500 employees are working on this permanent challenge at over 90 locations on all continents.
We have an excellent career opportunity for an Applications Specialist in our Microbiology & Diagnostics Division supporting our customers, as well as sales and service team within the Nederlands. The role has arisen due to continued success in business growth and product development.
The key focus of the position is growing our systems and consumables revenue in the Nederlands by pre-sales activities to support the local sales team, demonstration of our technologies to the customers, application support, and customer training.
Aufgaben/Verantwortlichkeiten:
Pre-sales support by joining the Bruker Nederland sales team at customer sites for sales visits and sales discussions about Bruker’s solutions
Sales support and lead generation by demonstrating the usage at customer sites during trainings, support, events etc.
Demonstration of Bruker’s solutions in the Bruker Bremen demo lab, or at customer sites in the Nordics and Baltics
Processing sample evaluations for customers and generating result reports; presentation of the results to the customers, either on-site or on-line
Active participation in conferences, seminars, and exhibitions, including booth duty and consultation for interested prospects
Providing high level and quality customer training
Technical support of our customers and enabling them to fully explore the capabilities of their instrument investments and application support
Qualifikationen:
Background in Microbiology & Diagnostics including bacterial ID, sepsis workflow, and antibiotic susceptibility testing
Practical experience in using MALDI technology
Excellent ability and willingness to communicate and closely interact with our customers
Willingness to travel within the Nederlands for approx. 60% of the time; international travels possible as well (internal trainings and meetings, participation in instrument demonstrations in the European lab in Bremen, Germany; potential support of other territories on a case-by-case basis)
Ability to continuously support customers via emails and phone calls in a timely manner
High customer orientation
Flexibility, the ability to work in a team, self-motivation, and commitment
Experienced PC user with knowledge of MS Office
Fluency in Dutch & English

Your role:


In this position you handle customer orders and provide information about products, services and order status. You will proceed improvement initiatives, challenge processes and seek new opportunities to increase customer relations efficiently. You will deal directly with customer inquiries received via all medias and respond to customer inquiries. You will proactively look for solutions to customer issues and obtain and evaluate all relevant information to handle inquiries. You will manage customer accounts including reporting and file records of customer interactions and transactions. You will record details of inquiries, comments and complaints within quality management system. You will handle administration tasks and communicate and coordinate with internal departments.


Who you are:


Experienced in a customer facing role and comfortable in interacting with people from a diverse set of backgrounds and roles.
Knowledge of customer order management cycle and supply chain processes would be a benefit as well as familiarity with ERP and CRM systems.
Have a positive approach on taking care of customers and know how to prioritize daily tasks.
Have a continuous improvement approach and accuracy and attention to details.
Happy to work in a fast paced and diverse environment.
A true team member who can also work individually.
Proficient in English and one of the following languages; Danish, Swedish, Norwegian, Finnish, Dutch or French.

We celebrate all dimensions of diversity and believe that it drives excellence and innovation, strengthening our ability to lead in science and technology. This position is offered office based in Geneva and London, or home based in Switzerland, United Kingdom, Spain, France, Italy, Germany, the Netherlands.
Brief Description:
Responsible for leading UBC Pharmacovigilance (PV) project teams to deliver contracted services and ensuring achievement of contracted project milestones for assigned projects.
Requirements:
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience.
Minimum of 4 year direct project management experience at a Contract Research Organization (CRO) or pharmaceutical company and/ or 6 years of pharmacovigilance experience.
Knowledge of global and local PV regulations and legislation, both pre- and post-marketing, preferred.
Strong project management, interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills, both internally and towards clients.
Ability to identity, document, track and resolve project action items for multiple programs simultaneously.
Ability to create, review and revise documentation, processes and procedures as they relate to PV activities, to identify issues/problem areas, assess compliance, and communicates findings to the appropriate team(s) and management.
Experience with Argus or other industry standard safety database(s)
Project financial expertise including invoicing, revenue recognition, margin analysis, scope management and resource management.
Demonstrated supervisory skills preferred.
Demonstrated independent problem solving and issue resolution track record.
Excellent interpersonal and client management skills.
Effective presentation skills.
Must be flexible and adaptable to quickly changing project priorities
Must be able to speak fluent English.
Ability to travel to UBC locations, clients, and professional/scientific meetings.
Supervisory Responsibilities:
Matrix supervision of project team(s).
Mentors Junior Project Manager(s).
Expected Project Load: 2 to 5 projects (global and local) depending on scope.
Specific Job Duties:
Manages Pharmacovigilance project(s) as assigned by UBC PV Management per the scope of work and within the contracted budget and timelines.
Responsible for the overall on time, on-budget delivery of the contracted Scope of Work for assigned projects.
Oversees all aspects of the PV project conduct from Start-up through Close-Out.
Responsible for on-time and on-budget delivery of the project
Serves as UBC primary contact with the client.
Ensures appropriate project related communication within the project team.
Leads and coordinates internal project and client teleconferences/meetings.
Prepares project timelines and project management related deliverables.
Identity, document, track and resolve project action items for multiple programs simultaneously
Establishes and manages project communication tools (e.g. project email address, project specific teleconference number, project portal/SharePoint).
Coordinates development of Project Specific plans to achieve contracted milestones (i.e., Adverse Event Reporting Plan, Periodic Safety reporting Plan).
Prepares and maintains Project Management Plan.
Ensures project is conducted in concert with UBC Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs), project-specific procedures and client’s SOPs and, in accordance to the highest quality standards.
Prepares and keeps the Project team log and project specific training matrix up-to-date.
Ensures project specific trainings are assigned to relevant project team member as per project specific training matrix.
Maintains and files project specific training records for the project team.
Prepares project metrics & Key Performance Indicators (KPI) and monthly metrics reports, as needed.
Supports Qualified Person Responsible for Pharmacovigilance in Europe (EU QPPV) and local QPPV(s) in his/her activities throughout the project.
Prepares project specific presentations for client meetings/audits.
Assists in project specific audit/inspection preparation and actively participate in the audit/inspection.
Develops and implements Corrective and Preventive Actions (CAPAs) related to Project Management issues as necessary.
Ensures that project specific CAPAs/SIRs are being closed on time.
Tracks non-compliance issues occurring in the frame of his/her projects.• Escalates issues in a timely manner to the PV Director /Associate Director who supervises the project.
Maintains cumulative list of Actions items for the project including owner, due date, status, etc…
Reviews contract and project scope to ensure that change orders (CO) are issued as necessary.
Works with UBC contracts team on CO development and execution.
Performs project financial oversight (identify percent complete units for monthly revenue recognition meeting with Finance as well as forecast future unit completion).
Ensure project budget is tracked against contract milestones.
Oversees project profitability analysis and present findings as requested to Senior PV Management.
Supports business development initiatives including proposal, slides, attendance at bid defense meetings and proposal and budget development.
Determines the need for third party vendor services and coordinate vendor management activities
Other duties as assigned by Senior Management.
UBC is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class. We are committed to a diverse, equitable and inclusive culture that fosters respect for each other, our clients, and our patients.
#LI-REMOTE

Work Your Magic with us!


Ready to explore, break barriers, and discover more? We know you've got big plans - so do we! Our colleagues across the globe love innovating with science and technology to enrich people's lives with our solutions in Healthcare, Life Science, and Electronics. Together, we dream big and are passionate about caring for our rich mix of people, customers, patients, and planet. That's why we are always looking for curious minds that see themselves imagining the unimaginable with us.


United As One for Patients, our purpose in Healthcare is to help create, improve and prolong lives. We develop medicines, intelligent devices and innovative technologies in therapeutic areas such as Oncology, Neurology and Fertility. Our teams work together across 6 continents with passion and relentless curiosity in order to help patients at every stage of life. Joining our Healthcare team is becoming part of a diverse, inclusive and flexible working culture, presenting great opportunities for personal development and career advancement across the globe.


Your role:


We are looking for an experienced professional who can support the team to ensure that the availability of the products is in the right place at the right time with the right quantity. This involves aspects of incoming goods, logistics, warehousing and distribution of finished products. You will be the main contact person for direct and indirect customers and be responsible for order to cash process e.g. order entry, order fulfillment, invoicing, and customer payment collection. You will handle complaints, returns, and ensure a correct follow-up in compliance with law and (GDP) regulation. You will also assure a good service level to our customers in an efficient and effective way. In addition, you will support to line manager on supply chain tasks on Demand and Inventory management and on ad hoc base projects and assignments on request


Who you are:


Educated to a minimum MBO level with 1-2 years of working experience in a similar role.
Proficient in Dutch and English.
Adaptive, cooperative and a fast learner.
Has strong interpersonal skills.
A good planner and has a sense for time management.
Has good organizational and analytical skills.
What we offer: We are curious minds that come from a broad range of backgrounds, perspectives, and life experiences. We celebrate all dimensions of diversity and believe that it drives excellence and innovation, strengthening our ability to lead in science and technology. We are committed to creating access and opportunities for all to develop and grow at your own pace. Join us in building a culture of inclusion and belonging that impacts millions and empowers everyone to work their magic and champion human progress!

Apply now and become a part of our diverse team!

Overview
At the heart of QIAGEN’s business is a vision to make improvements in life possible.

We are on an exciting mission to make a real difference in science and healthcare. We are still the entrepreneurial company we started out as and have today achieved a size where we can bring our full power to many initiatives and to our presence across the globe.
Our most valuable asset are our employees – more than 5000 in over 35 locations around the world. Our ambition is to ensure we have outstanding and passionate people working in the best teams and we are constantly looking for new talent to join us.
There are few players who have shaped the world of modern science and healthcare as much as QIAGEN, and we have only just started.
If you are looking to advance your career, are seeking new challenges and opportunities, enjoy working in dynamic and international, diverse teams and want to make a real impact on people’s lives, then QIAGEN is where you need to be.


Join us. At QIAGEN, you make a difference every day.
Position Description
We are open to applications from candidates based in various European countries including UK, Poland, France, Germany, Spain, Italy.

The Regulatory Affairs team at QIAGEN fulfill a global function, working with and advising product development teams, preparing regulatory submissions for the relevant countries, and supporting change control processes. An exciting new opportunity has arisen for an experienced Regulatory Affairs professional to take on a Senior Management role.

Key responsibilities:
Participate on project development teams and support project and product teams from a regulatory perspective.
Prepare and submit regulatory submissions to notified bodies as required for global approvals for in vitro diagnostic (IVD) products, including preparation of reports and interaction with regulatory officials as required. To include European (e.g. IVDR, MDR), US (e.g. 510k, PMA) and Health Canada (e.g. Class III) regulations.
Research and interpret regulations, guidelines and precedents to support interdepartmental project teams in developing strategies, policies and procedures that ensure regulatory compliance with global regulatory agencies.
Interface with regulatory agencies for inquiries and issues.
Position Requirements
Significant experience in a regulated industry, with proven experience in Regulatory Affairs preparing EU Technical Documentation, US FDA 510(k) and/or PMA submissions.
Good working knowledge of the MDR and IVDR, applicable ISO standards, and US medical device (IVD) regulations.
Ability to work on complex problems and exercise sound science-based decision making in developing regulatory strategies and solutions to regulatory problems.
Ability to work collaboratively in cross-functional teams and to convey complex regulatory requirements in a straightforward and practical manner with employees at all levels of the organization as well as with key individuals outside the organization, e.g. FDA reviewers, consultants. #Li-remote
What we offer
At the heart of QIAGEN are our people who drive our success. We act with passion, always challenging the status quo to drive innovation and continuous improvement. We inspire with our leadership and make an impact with our actions. We create a collaborative, safe and engaging workplace which forms the basis for high performing individuals and teams. We drive accountability and entrepreneurial decision-making and want you to excel your growth and shape the future of QIAGEN.

QIAGEN is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, or disability.
Job Reference: EMEA02763

At Genmab, we’re committed to building extra[not]ordinary futures together, by developing antibody products and pioneering, knock-your-socks-off therapies that change the lives of patients and the future of cancer treatment and serious diseases. From our people who are caring, candid, and impact-driven to our business, which is innovative and rooted in science, we believe that being proudly unique, determined to be our best, and authentic is essential to fulfilling our purpose.
The Role
As Associate Director Payroll Operations you will be responsible for ensuring the timely and accurate completion of all employee compensation for all Europe and remote working locations within the region. In this role you will work closely with the HR colleagues and various 3rd party payroll providers. As Associate Director Payroll Operations you will oversee the company’s payroll processes in addition to following and filing all legal requirements for taxes, audits, and other payroll related reporting.
This is a key position within the European Accounting Operations Teams and a great opportunity for an experienced, motivated, and ambitious payroll professional. You will be working in a highly motivated team of experienced professionals in an organization where we value innovation, determination, respect, integrity, and teamwork. We are looking for candidates who will be able to combine a hands-on approach to the daily payroll activities while at the same time having the ability to further develop the payroll function strategically to support the company’s rapid growth.
Responsibilities
To oversee and manage all payroll activities within our European locations (currently ~570+ employees in the Netherlands, ~400+ employees in Denmark) plus remote workers in Belgium, France, Austria, Germany, Spain, UK and Italy according to applicable laws and regulations (with support of an external payroll provider). This include, but is not limited, to monthly payroll processes, month-end close activities, and activities related to LTI and tax reporting.
To anticipate with the local payroll providers that all mandatory local requirements are met and that legal changes are implemented as applicable.
To support the rapid growth of the company within Europe and ensure a best-in-class payroll set-up.
To be a business partner for the HR Operations Teams and the Global Compensation & Benefits Team to improve the overall employee experience.
To ensure timely and accurate reporting (e.g., vacation accruals, etc.) and provide key information to internal stakeholders, hereunder the Accounting Team.
To lead audits of payroll activities (e.g., SOX and external audits).
To ensure data quality in the payroll processes and systems.
To respond to payroll questions in a timely manner.
To proactively optimize processes and operations to comply with internal and external policies and regulations and improve our ways of working.
To lead and motivate a team of payroll specialists. Supervise, train and coach staff where necessary and instill a culture of integrity, respect, collaboration, and teamwork within the team.
To support the implementation and administration of compensation and benefits initiatives.
To ensure that the payroll team is trained and up to date on payroll matters.
To collaborate successfully with internal and external stakeholders across the organization on a global level.
Requirements
Bachelor’s / master’s degree in business or equivalent and further education within payroll or equivalent qualification / work experience.
10+ years of experience in the payroll and/or compensation and benefits field.
Ideally 3-5 years of experience in managing payroll activities across multiple European locations.
Experience with managing outsourced payroll providers is a must.
Good knowledge of Dutch labor law, socials security and tax regulations.
Advanced Excel and reporting knowledge, preferably Workday, Cobra and SAP.
Ability to work independently and handle multiple competing priorities in a fast-paced multicultural environment.
Can easily adjust in a rapidly growing and changing organization.
Strong organization, planning and communication skills.
Problem solving mindset with hands on attitude when it comes to finding solutions.
Strong coaching leadership skills with ability to supervise and motivate staff located in multiple geographic areas.
Exceptional inter-personal skills, collaborative working style, and with strong verbal and written communication skills.
Strong team player with ability to build and maintaining strong relationships with key internal and external stakeholders.
Fluent language skills both written and verbal, in Dutch and English is required. Additional language skills would be beneficial but not a must.
About You
You are passionate about our purpose and genuinely care about our mission to transform the lives of patients through innovative cancer treatment
You bring rigor and excellence to all that you do. You are a fierce believer in our rooted-in-science approach to problem-solving
You are a generous collaborator who can work in teams with diverse backgrounds
You are determined to do and be your best and take pride in enabling the best work of others on the team
You are not afraid to grapple with the unknown and be innovative
You have experience working in a fast-growing, dynamic company (or a strong desire to)
You work hard and are not afraid to have a little fun while you do so
Locations
Genmab leverages the effectiveness of an agile working environment, when possible, for the betterment of employee work-life balance. Our offices are designed as open, community-based spaces that work to connect employees while being immersed in our state-of-the-art laboratories. Whether you’re in one of our collaboratively designed office spaces or working remotely, we thrive on connecting with each other to innovate.
About Genmab
Founded in 1999 in Copenhagen, Denmark, Genmab is an innovative biotech company that has become a leader in antibody biology and innovation. Our product pipeline and next-generation antibody technologies are the result of our strong company culture, a deep passion for innovation, and desire to transform cancer treatment and serious diseases.
When you work with us, you’ll be part of a warm, fun, dynamic community, and team up with some of the best, most authentic individuals in locations around the world, who care deeply and share in a relentless drive to innovate and create transformational medicines. People who are candid, impact-driven, and a little unconventional; who seek out and embrace the opportunity to build new and bold futures within a rapidly growing and innovative biotech company; who bring their full selves to work and show up for each other - rolling up their sleeves to get the job done. This translates into a place where you can be authentically you; are empowered to innovate, build solutions, and execute; feel cared for and supported in growth; and are a critical part of changing the lives of patients around the world through transformative cancer treatment.
Our commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion
We are committed to fostering workplace diversity at all levels of the company and we believe it is essential for our continued success. No applicant shall be discriminated against or treated unfairly because of their race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), national origin, age, disability, or genetic information. Learn more about our commitments on our website.
Genmab is committed to protecting your personal data and privacy. Please see our privacy policy for handling your data in connection with your application on our website https://www.genmab.com/privacy.
Please note that if you are applying for a position in the Netherlands, Genmab’s policy for all permanently budgeted hires in NL is initially to offer a fixed-term employment contract for a year, if the employee performs well and if the business conditions do not change, renewal for an indefinite term may be considered after the fixed-term employment contract.

Make your mark for patients
We are looking for a RWE Expert with a passion for data and enthusiastic innovative mindset, to come join our fantastic Global Real World Evidence Team, based in either Belgium, Germany or UK. We are also open to other EU locations, Netherlands or Switzerland.
About the role
As the RWE Expert, you will be responsible for designing and executing global real-world evidence (RWE) projects to inform strategic internal decision-making thereby empowering differentiating R&D activities within UCB, support external decision making by key stakeholder groups such as patients, regulators, policy makers, payers, and prescribers and contribute to the wider epidemiological and medical understanding of specific diseases.
Depending on business need, you will help conceptualize RWE projects to meet business needs and drive the Global RWE Strategy and Tactical Plan.
Who you’ll work with:
You work with the RWE Data Analyst team, the RWE Strategy Lead and internal stakeholders. And you represent RWE on functional teams within the Mission(s) (e.g., early/development solution teams, Medical Team, Patient Safety, Regulatory, Market Access, Commercial/Marketing, Core Launch Teams. You report directly to the RWE Strategy Lead.
What will you do:
Providing strategic input to internal stakeholders based on RWE activities and robust epidemiological and medical understanding of the patient population in focus
Leading and driving innovative RWE study design, planning and execution, including protocol development and analysis specification following best methodological standards. Including new data sources and advanced analytics. (incl. digital pharmacoepidemiology)
Providing input to helps drive the Global RWE Strategy & Tactical Plan based on request from the RWE Strategy Lead responsible for the respective patient population
Providing RWE Analysts with clarifications concerning protocol implementation
Driving interpretation of analysis in collaboration with RWE Strategy Lead & internal stakeholders, and communicating analysis interpretation internally and externally
Supporting RWE Strategy Lead to ensure alignment of RWE tactics with the Strategic Publication Plan.
Interested? For this position you’ll need the following education, experience and skills:
MSc. / PhD in Life Sciences of which Epidemiology background is preferred, other like Outcome research, statistical backgrounds are favorable
You have successfully conceptualized and delivered RWE projects using primary or secondary data (within the pharmaceutical industry or with a recognized expert consultancy or academic center of excellence)
Ability to translate project work into scientific communications, and deliver impactful presentations to peers and/or internal stakeholders with a relaxed and proficient presentation style
Experience working with multidisciplinary cross functional and cross-cultural project teams
Ability to use your relationships with internal and external stakeholder groups to provide strategic input through synthesized thinking, building advocacy and empowering implementation of the solutions in support of creating patient value and UCB portfolio performance
Passion for innovation and creativity. Able to learn fast and adapt to new ways of working, be open-minded and science driven
RANDATUCB
Are you ready to ‘go beyond’ to create value and make your mark for patients? If this sounds like you, then we would love to hear from you!
About us
UCB is a global biopharmaceutical company, focusing on neurology and immunology. We are around 8,500 people in all four corners of the globe, inspired by patients and driven by science.
Why work for us?
At UCB, we don’t just complete tasks, we create value. We aren’t afraid to push forward, collaborate, and innovate to make our mark for patients. We have a caring, supportive culture where everyone feels included, respected and has equitable opportunities to do their best work. We ‘go beyond’ to create value for our patients, and always with a human focus, whether that’s on our patients, our employees or our planet. Working for us, you will discover a place where you can grow, and have the freedom to carve your own career path to achieve your full potential.
Learn more about sustainability at UCB and how it is integrated into our business approach.
UCB and its subsidiaries encourage diversity and inclusion in the workplace; we are an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race/colour/religion/sex/national origin/veteran/disability/age/sexual orientation/gender identity.

Company Overview
Rhythm is a global, commercial-stage biopharmaceutical company committed to transforming the care of people living with rare melanocortin-4 receptor (MC4R) pathway diseases. Working at Rhythm means that you are part of a team that’s passionate about transforming the lives of people living with hyperphagia (pathological, insatiable hunger) and severe obesity caused by rare MC4R pathway diseases. We recognize the courage it takes for patients and their caregivers to begin their journey of advocacy to find the answers they need. Their courage inspires us to challenge convention, ask bold questions and seek answers for them. Every day, we strive for excellence through our willingness to adapt, learn, and our tenacity to overcome barriers, together.
Opportunity Overview
Rhythm Pharmaceuticals is seeking a highly motivated candidate for a International Controller who will be responsible for the management of accounting and reporting, internal controls and tax compliance for the international Region business. This position will report to the Chief Accounting Officer, with a dotted line to the Head of Finance & Commercial Operations, International Region and work closely with the International senior management team and the corporate finance Team based in Boston..
As an International Controller, the ideal candidate will work with the International management team and Corporate Accounting and Finance teams to ensure standard accounting policies and practices are applied and manage the financial accounting, tax and internal control compliance at the international subsidiaries. This person should have significant knowledge and expertise in working in international setting, in a high growth environment where many policies and procedures to support the business will evolve and be further defined as businesses come online and mature.
Responsibilities and Duties
Direct oversight of all transactional accounting activities for Rhythm’s subsidiaries located in the Netherlands, France, Germany, Italy, Spain and the UK. This individual will also oversee the International Region activities where Rhythm is present and not have, at least for the moment, subsidiaries.
In close collaboration with CAO and VP International Finance, develop and oversee shared service functions supporting Purchase-to-Pay, Order-to-cash, and record-to-report in key international jurisdictions, balancing internal human resources and outside service providers
Verify accuracy and completeness of [country-level statutory and US GAAP] financial statements and supplementary reporting information with accounting procedures and controls and through balance sheet reviews
Design, implement, and monitor, processes, controls and systems for international locations
Develop and optimize indirect tax compliance and management capabilities
Partner with the international management team to help drive growth, enabling robust infrastructure support across a broad range of accounting and finance related matters
Develop and maintain procedures for an effective internal control environment over international operations.
Manage external SOX, Tax and external audit firm for related work
Help establish international subsidiaries (when necessary) and maintain local compliance, tax and accounting support with our 3rd party vendor RSM
Assist in overseeing 3PL order to cash vendor Movionto. Maintain process and control over credit limits for international market
Establish inventory controls and conduct inventories when it becomes material
Work closely with Human Resources on administration of country level benefits and HR outsourced partner Vistra
Assist with monthly revenue calculations for international markets
Perform monthly and quarterly closing activities for international locations with the support of RSM and Corporate Assistant controller
Perform, on request, other related business support/accounting finance duties
Provide effective leadership of personnel to achieve corporate objectives, department goals, maintain desired corporate culture and philosophy and adhere to company policies.
Management of direct reports, when applicable; this includes selection, training development, performance feedback and yearly written performance evaluations.
Exercise sound data stewardship following data policies (retention, privacy, security)
Qualifications and Skills
Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent in accounting, and CPA license or equivalent (Chartered Accountant)
Minimum of 10 years of progressive accounting and finance experience with a minimum of 4+ years supporting international operations
Experience with Pharmaceutical Industry / Biotech required
Able to speak different European languages (on top of English) preferred (French, German, Italian or Spanish)
Experience with transfer pricing, VAT reporting and compliance
Well versed in current GAAP accounting, especially related to revenue recognition and foreign currency, income taxes, internal controls
Knowledge of Microsoft D365 general ledger system
Exceptional organizational, prioritization, decision making, and planning skills as the candidate will need the ability to manage multiple priorities effectively to achieve the overall goals of department and company
Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment, meet deadlines, multi-task efficiently and manage individuals
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, to be able to identify and pro-actively propose system and process improvement
Excellent oral and written communication skills
Excellent interpersonal skills, detail oriented, with high level of ethics and integrity
This role is based Amsterdam. Rhythm operates in a hybrid-work model. Candidates applying must be willing and able to be in the International office in coordination with their department and business needs. This role may involve some travel.
More about Rhythm
Rhythm is a global, commercial-stage biopharmaceutical company aimed at developing and commercializing therapies for the treatment of rare genetic diseases of hyperphagia and severe obesity due to rare melanocortin-4 receptor (MC4R) pathway diseases. This is a key biological pathway that regulates weight and hunger. A central element of Rhythm’s mission is to improve the understanding of these diseases and develop management strategies for patients who have no treatment options available to them. Rhythm was founded in 2008 and is based in Boston, MA. The company’s clinical development program is currently focused on several rare MC4R pathway diseases. For healthcare professionals, visit www.RareObesity.com for more information. For those who may be affected or would like to learn more, visit www.LEADforRareObesity.com for more information.

Your role: As Principal (Sr) Salesforce Solution Architect you will be responsible to co-design and drive a capability-driven technology roadmap for our Life Science (LS) business. You will regularly interact with the LS commercial heads and executive steerco and act as primary expert on technical and business aspects of the Salesforce application landscape. You will bring thought leadership in innovation and bring the best technology and processes for our Life Science business. You will work with and steer an internal and external team of Salesforce solution architects, technical architects and development teams to deliver best-class Salesforce solutions for the Life Science Business. You lead and set priorities for a team of Salesforce solution architects to deliver a continuous pipeline of enhancements and projects. You co-drive the development of capability-based technology roadmap for Salesforce, leading into a portfolio of projects to build or strengthen prioritized capabilities and l ead PoCs (new functionalities / capability building and innovation areas) and demo to the business. You stay ahead of the curve with innovations, educate yourself and enable others on current and emerging technologies. Drive the same spirit in your team - be a trailblazer in your area. You consult with Product Owners and various stakeholders on the business side to understand their technical and business challenges related and translate this into a focused delivery and innovation roadmap. You propose best-in-class solutions leveraging standard functionalities as much as possible (zero to low coding), strive for solution harmonization between business units and act as principal architect: be an active member on the LS Architecture review Board, arbitrate architectural decisions and trade-offs, review the solution designs put forward by your team members and ensure a consistent solution architecture according to industry standards. You ensure the solution built by the technical development teams meets the described acceptance criteria and fits the solution design before handing it over to the business (final quality assurance).


Job can be also located in Belgium, France or Spain.

Who you are:


10+ years' experience in solution design & technical delivery of Software As A Service platforms / equivalent; whereof minimum 5 years in (minimum1, preferable more) Salesforce products (Sales Cloud, Service Cloud, Marketing Cloud).
Thorough understanding of best practices and latest OOB features to be able to steer decisions and trade-offs between no-code and custom code and aim to constantly reduce technical debt in our Salesforce landscape.
Minimum one relevant and up to date Salesforce Architect Certification (preferably Data Architect) and willingness to add additional relevant certifications (with organizational support).
Experience leading customer-facing requirement gathering and exploration sessions to conceptualize and design complex business solutions.
Experience in writing functional requirements, preferably in a user story (map) format.
Experience mapping and documenting solution design / diagrams (e.g. in tools such as Elements.cloud).
Familiarity with data architecture/schema, including relational data models and sql syntax, documentation of data models, and data flows.
Strong understanding of implementing web services such as SOAP and REST APIs with a good understanding of interfaces across enterprise landscapes: e.g. SAP ERP, MDM etc.
Experience in managing Salesforce platform in terms of ensuring performance, security, development best-practices and technical architecture.
Highly efficient team player with the ability to also work independently in a fast-paced, fluid environment.
Experience in leading a team (of Salesforce experts); people management skills.
Comfortable in a mentoring role (towards Solution Architects on the team) and passionate about sharing knowledge and developing team members to grow.
Experience in Application / Platform Management (incident mgt, service mgt, compliance, governance...) -good understanding of ITIL processes or certification.
Excellent presentation and verbal skills with technical, non-technical, end-user, and executive audiences - ability to adjust your message to your audience.
Excellent command of written and spoken English.
Experience working in a global environment with remote teams.
Willingness and ability to travel internationally for workshops and meetings.
What we offer: We are curious minds that come from a broad range of backgrounds, perspectives, and life experiences. We celebrate all dimensions of diversity and believe that it drives excellence and innovation, strengthening our ability to lead in science and technology. We are committed to creating access and opportunities for all to develop and grow at your own pace. Join us in building a culture of inclusion and belonging that impacts millions and empowers everyone to work their magic and champion human progress!

job_titles: Senior Director Business Development Laboratory Services
job_description:
Do you want to be part of an organization that is making a difference in the lives of millions of people worldwide? If so, we want to hear from you!

As Senior Director Business Development Laboratory Services you will be responsible for expanding the QPS bioanalysis business in the Nordic countries and Germany with existing prospects, identify new customers, and close revenue-generating business opportunities with pharmaceuticals and biotechs. In order to achieve this objective, you will identify potential new clients through active cold calls and face-to-face meetings, effectively negotiate business terms and close deals. In this role you will develop an important network within the sales territory and position QPS as a primary or preferred provider. You will play a pivotal part in the development of new medicines to treat human diseases.
QPS’ Story

Since its inception, QPS has been assisting pharmaceutical, biotechnology and medical device companies with their drug development efforts by providing a full range of Neuropharmacology, DMPK, Toxicology, Bioanalysis, Translational Medicine, Early Phase Clinical and Phase II – IV Clinical Research services. To meet the needs of our clients, we strive to employ talented, caring and committed individuals who will work collaboratively towards achieving our mission of improving human health and the quality of life.

Team members enjoy challenging and rewarding work, and are encouraged achieve their best. Underpinning the operation is a culture that values diversity, innovation, accountability, team work and a friendly atmosphere where performance is recognized and rewarded. We provide unique company benefits, training, and advancement opportunities. Most importantly, we value each of our team members as employees and as individuals.
If this sounds like your ideal work environment, then we would love to speak with you, so apply today!
The Job

Prospect, generate and develop new leads/business opportunities for the QPS' services: Bioanalysis (small molecule, biotherapeutics and gene therapy), Translational Medicine (Biomarkers and Pharmacogenomics), DMPK and Toxicology.
Plan, coordinate and execute all client sales activities. Set up and coordinate face-to-face meetings with prospects in collaboration with our scientific experts.
Generate Request for Proposals (RFPs) from new clients.
Drive sales to closure working in conjunction with Technical Operations and Commercial Operations staff.
Network and relationship-building at decision-maker level across key accounts. Represent and promote QPS at industry meetings.
Work with Operations and internal BD team to direct and coordinate client visits to QPS’ facilities, including pre-visit strategy, meetings and agenda.
Account planning & execution and forecasting, effectively utilize CRM (Salesforce.com).
Be part of a growing, dynamic, and multi-cultural team and share experiences, plans and ideas.
Around 50-60% of your time for business travel in Europe.
Requirements

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in science or business, or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Home-office based in Germany (preferred), Netherlands, Belgium, UK, Nordics, and 5-10 years of experience in CRO or pharmaceutical/biotech sales is preferable.
A "hunter" mentality and a taste for challenges, the ability to work cross-culturally and to accommodate communications across global time zones (US, Europe and Asia).
Proven experience in managing the sales process from lead generation through close including prospecting, networking, cold-calling, meetings, presenting, following up, and convincing.
A good command of English and German, both spoken and written. Other European languages are desired (e.g. Scandinavian languages).
Experience in creating and executing territory sales plans and the ability to achieve corporately assigned sales targets.
Knowledge and contacts within the Global Pharma/Biotech industry, specifically in segments as identified above are preferable.
Why you should apply

Great learning and career opportunities. Our seasoned professionals are here to support and work with you to explore your learning potential and career goals.
Structured Career Ladders that provide excellent growth based on your personal aspirations.
Work collaboratively towards achieving our mission of improving human health and the quality of life.
Be part of an organization where diversity, creativity and challenge will be your day to day working environment.
Excellent primary and secondary working conditions.
Do you want to apply or learn more?

If you want to play a pivotal part in improving human health and the quality of life, we are looking forward to receive your application in English. Do you want to learn more about QPS? Please visit our website at www.qps.com.
If you want to apply for this job you can contact Reiner Sulter, Recruiter, by telephone +31(0)6 11 85 59 10.

Happy to answer your questions and to tell you all about this exciting position at QPS!

Your role:


As a Key Account Manager, you will deliver defined targets on sales, patient share, market share, and perception of brand (70% focus Bavencio, 30% Erbitux). You will spend 80% of your time on the market, engaging customers throughout the Netherlands and driving operational excellence by focusing on strategic accounts. Oncology is a key strategic area of focus for us, and that opens opportunities for work on future launches, at the right timelines. You will build positive relationships with customers through regular contacts in line with strategy & KPIs defined. You will analyze the market and translate the analysis into clear business opportunities. You will develop and implement account plans for key accounts in collaboration with the cross-functional team. You will have a good understanding of the market, treatments, and trends. Identification of customer and market needs and pro-actively proposing potential solutions to the cross-functional team will be key. You will build in label product knowledge (core data and latest publications), and usage of data and materials in customer interactions. You will drive behavioral change: effective messaging based on brand strategy, clear objective setting to build brand perception & advocacy. You will secure KOL engagement and identify the right value propositions to drive KOL engagement and own and execute defined projects. You will proactively seek to understand competitor activities, strategies and programs and ensure that CI is shared broadly within the organization.

Ideally educated to a scientific or business degree.
An experienced sales professional with familiarity of the oncology therapeutic area.
Have an Oncology network in the Netherlands
Result oriented, customer focused with strong execution focus
Are energized by the opportunity to add value to patients and they are the center of your focus
Positive team player, self-driven and have excellent collaboration and interpersonal skills
Proficient in Dutch and English

job_titles: Environmental Health and Safety (EHS) Project Manager (HSE)
job_description:
Welcome to the Post Pollution Future with LanzaTech
A post-pollution world is inevitable, and people will either be part of it, or the planet will go on without us. At LanzaTech, our technology platform is transforming waste carbon into everyday products, to meet the needs of this moment. Our science is state-of-the-art, but the idea is simple. We use nature to heal nature. We capture carbon emissions which are then fed into bioreactors where trillions of carbon-hungry microbes go to work. These tiny dynamos consume the waste gases and produce valuable raw material commodities. Pure enough to be resold, repurposed, and recycled again — from sustainable jet fuel to beverage bottles, to yoga pants.
Founded in New Zealand, we are a global women-led company with an international footprint and a diverse employee population. Diversity, Equity & Inclusion are a key part of our mission and core values which we show through our hiring, our leadership, our efforts to educate internally and willingness to learn.
Now a publicly traded company on NASDAQ, come join the team as we strive to make a Post Pollution Future!
Exciting collaborations with LanzaTech (LT) CarbonSmartTM Products:
2022 – H&M announced their collaboration with LT with a clothing line to be launched in 2023
2022 – Coty, Inc. – LT recycled carbon ethanol to be used in majority of fragrance portfolio by 2023
2022 – DrogerieMark (dm) in Germany, launched a range of packaging for their “Denk Mit” range of dish soap
2022 – Danone announced a collaboration to make packaging for the Mizone water line in China
2022 – Craghoppers, UK outdoor company, made a fleece from recycled carbon, to be launched in 2023
2021 – Collaborations with ZARA, lululemon & L’Oréal using recycled carbon in their apparel & packaging
Notable acknowledgments:
2022 – Winner of “Air” Category at the 23rd Annual Energy Globe Awards
2022 – Fix Our Climate finalist for Earthshot Prize (only US company to be a finalist)
2022 – Jennifer Holmgren, CEO: TiE Sustainability Entrepreneur of the Year
2021 – Biofuels Digest #1 Hottest Company in Renewable Fuels, Chemicals & Biomaterials
Interested in learning more? Visit us at www.LanzaTech.com and download/stream our latest CarbonSmartTM Podcast on Apple, Google, Spotify or wherever you receive your podcasts!
This position is open to candidates authorized to work in any of the following: Netherlands, Belgium or the UK on a full-time basis for any employer. LanzaTech is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status..
About the role
This role is to be based out of one of LanzaTech’s European offices(Netherlands or Belgium)/or UK office but will report to the Director of EHS in the US. Primarily focused on environmental aspects, the successful candidate will be responsible for managing EHS elements for commercial and/or pilot scale projects implemented by LanzaTech.
Generally, the majority of work will be done by consultants that have been engaged by LanzaTech and this role will ensure they are meeting regulatory and company requirements. They will liaise with Project Managers (internal and external) as well as others on the global EHS Team to facilitate safe and environmentally sound projects. Additionally, the successful candidate will be tasked with assisting in environmental matters for existing company operations globally.
Key duties
Coordinating between EHS consultants and internal parties.
Reviewing applicable regulations to ensure project compliance.
Development and maintenance of tools for successful repeated implementation of EHS aspects of projects.
Supporting environmental aspects of LanzaTech’s global operations.
Development and delivery of environmental training across the organization.
Minimum Qualifications:
Bachelor’s Degree in Environmental Sciences/Engineering and 7+ years’ experience OR 10+ years’ experience in a project focused environmental management role with a Technical Degree (Chemistry, Biology, Engineering, etc)
Knowledge of EU and/or UK environmental regulations
Willingness to take initiative and work independently as well as in a team environment
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and project management skills
Willingness/ability to deliver training to large groups of people (50+)
Solid proficiency with Microsoft Office suite (Word, Excel and PowerPoint)
Preferred Qualifications
Strong background in environmental management.
Experience with environmental permitting, both in application and implementation.
Strong experience with the EU Seveso Directive and/or UK COMAH; Working knowledge of North American equivalents.
Prior work experience in EH&S consultancy or petrochemical EH&S project management

Overview:

The Manager Tax & Finance - EMEA will manage the day to day running of the direct and indirect taxes for EMEA, and provide support to the EMEA Finance Managers and Director of Finance. With 1 direct report as well as support from the wider Finance team.
Maintaining tight control of reporting deadlines ensuring consistency across different geographical locations (UK, Netherlands, France, Germany) and meeting local regulatory and legislative requirements. The individual within this role will support the Director of Finance, EMEA and Finance Managers in securing resolution in any matters or enquiries raised by any of the tax authorities within Europe.
This role will also play a key part in ensuring good quality financial data and reporting, supporting on accounting queries and activities as required, and improving the processes around tax related data gathering and reporting. To deliver this, there will also be a large part of the role requiring building and maintaining good relationships with the Tax team in the US, and external partners, such as tax advisors and auditors.
This is a full-time role, working 40 hours per week in a hybrid capacity.
Responsibilities:
This job contributes to organisational success by:
Improving systems and processes for the accurate preparation of tax provisions and compliance with tax requirements, supporting a strong internal control environment.
Support in preparing for and maintaining SOX controls requirements, relevant to EMEA, specifically focus on UK, Netherlands, France, Germany.
Maintaining an up to date awareness of relevant accounting rules and their impact.
Support the preparation of company tax computations and tax packs, working with the Finance Managers, Financial Accountant, US Tax team and external tax advisors.
Co-ordinating tax compliance and filings for European companies with external advisors and EMEA Finance Managers.
Playing a dominant part in resolution of enquiries on European tax matters, including tax audits, working with Finance Managers and the Director of Finance.
Reviewing and approving VAT and Intrastat returns for EMEA entities.
Providing updates and relevant information on EMEA tax matters to the Director of Finance, US Tax team, and Director of Tax.
Supporting the EMEA Finance Managers on reporting and provision of good quality financial information to the business.
Any other duties as reasonably can be expected of the role.
Qualifications:

Job requirements
Essential:
ACA / ACCA / CIMA qualification required with several years post qualification experience
Strong Excel and analytical skills
Excellent communication skills – written and verbal
Experience of working with external tax advisors and other business partners
Experience of working with direct & indirect taxation across multiple EMEA countries
Strong technical management or financial accounting skills and experience
Desirable:
Additional, relevant tax qualifications
Experience of developing internal control processes
Good people manager skills, with a desire to coach and develop others

Ready to explore, break barriers, and discover more? We know you've got big plans - so do we! Our colleagues across the globe love innovating with science and technology to enrich people's lives with our solutions in Healthcare, Life Science, and Electronics. Together, we dream big and are passionate about caring for our rich mix of people, customers, patients, and planet. That's why we are always looking for curious minds that see themselves imagining the unimaginable with us.


Everything we do in Electronics is to help us deliver on our purpose of being the company behind the companies, advancing digital living. We are dedicated to being the trusted supplier of high-tech materials, services and specialty chemicals for the electronics, automotive and cosmetics industries. We foster a global collaborative organization made up of individuals who have the passion to win, obsess about the customer, are relentlessly curious and act with urgency. Together, we push the boundaries of science to make more possible for our customers.


Your role


As a Reliability Engineer, you will contribute to the development, testing and qualification of new technologies, materials, and components for eyrise® dynamic glazing. Your work will be to assure our glazing products are reliable and will pass all the required tests in line with customer and market expectations. You will be a member of the Technology Development team of eyrise® and work closely together with Quality Assurance, Service, Engineering and external test and research institutes. You will be coordinating product reliability and durability tests, implement and validate test methods and assess test results. You will collaborate with external test and research institutes and implement improvements in the existing product design for dynamic glazing. You will assure that the product design complies with industry norms and standards. Identification and qualification of materials and components for dynamic glazing will be key as well as coordinating the fabrication of prototype devices. You will provide technical support to engineering, production, and quality departments as well as our customers. You will manage your own development projects in cooperation with other departments and external partners.


Who you are


You have a technical background (MSc or PhD) in mechanical engineering, materials science, or a related field.
Hands-on and have affinity with structural mechanics and reliability testing.
At least 5 years of experience in a relevant function.
Experienced in structural mechanics and reliability testing.
Supportive attitude towards the team and partners.
Good communication skills and the ability to discuss technical topics with other departments and external partners.
Proficiency in English (Dutch or German knowledge are an advantage)
